TopicTitle: Need to identify a part pack

Articles.Content:
Hi.

I had to reformat my HDD back in August, and just got around to reinstalling Kerbal. I made sure to save my craft files, but they were made using an add-on that increases the parts available. So my new install can't open them, and I can't recall which addon I used.

Parts identified:

cl.large.shortMonoTank

cl.large.BatteryPack

cl.radial.cylTankFuel

cl.radial.cylTankOxy

So a large ring battery pack, a small monopropellant tank, and small radial fuel and oxydiser tanks (coloured blue and orange, as I recall).

Anyone recognise it?

I found a

name = cl_radial_cylTankOxy

in my install, it's from KSPX.

Edit: Actually, the "cl" prefix kind of gives it away - it most probably stands for Claira Lyrae, the original maker of KSPX.

Edited November 1, 2013 by blizzy78

Oh about that.

cl.large.shortMonoTank

cl.large.BatteryPack

Both of those parts are now stock parts. So you'll want to download an earlier version of KSPX, I think that would be v2.2, it can be found on the forum page
But I don't want to be out of date...would it be possible to edit the craft files to use the stock parts instead, and use the new KSPX to fill in the blanks for the ones that aren't integrated?

You could just cut and paste those parts into the latest build, load your craft in the VAB, and then save them with the stock parts. I know this might sound like a hassle, but if you're willing to edit your craft files then it's surely not for the sake of convenience...
It actually doesn't sound that much worse than installing an addon, but with more search-and-replace. Trick will be finding the names of the relevent parts.

The parts are outdated but won't break your game. If those parts would've been kept in the pack, no change would have been made to the cfg files. So just go ahead and add them to the game, replace them with stock equivalents then remove them, nothing bad should happen
